evidence.text:
Person A: Where are you from that things don’t eat each other?
Person A: Well who made you?
Person A: So what you gonna name him?
Person B: I assign to you Gosling zero-zero-zero- one.
Person A: Just have a little fun for once?

Person B: My name has numbers.
Person A: It’s gotta be personal.
Person B: Storytelling is lying adjacent, and I lie for a living. Watch and learn. Just fill in the blanks.

Person A: How do we reset Brightbill?
Person A: That will damage him.

Person B: Not yet. And what this little gosling needed, was a mother. So he looked up at the stars, and asked the brightest one if it could send him one of their extras. Funny thing is, there’s this beautiful robot that happened to be sitting on the edge of that star. And she hears him.
Person B: Very lucky to be a mother.
Person A: Yeah, well. When you grow up without something, you spend a lot of time thinking about it.

Person A: Beats me. Nothing weird about you two.
Person A: Show me, deer!
Person B: Skuuuuuunk. Skunkie, skunkie, skunkie!

Person A: Roz. He needs to become independent if he’s gonna migrate.
Person B: I prefer he be independent, closer to home.
Person A: He won’t die. Well, probably won’t die. It’s unlikely he would die just, right now.
Person A: Don’t take this the wrong way, but I’m not sure I’d want to see the sort of place you actually fit in.
Person B: I’m fine. Go again.

Person A: Then we’ll find someone who can.
Person A: We have a proposition.

Person A: Remember. There’s nothing he can do that you can’t!
Person A: So, he’s safe, right?
Person B: Hm? Maybe.
Person B: Unless you want to stay. Cause we could hang out and do stuff.

Person A: How do you know if you love, something? Someone?
Person B: If you do, you should probably tell them.
Person A: What if it is too late?
Person A: It is good to see a friend.

Person B: Are you sure about this? We could have the whole island to ourselves come spring.
Person A: Nor me. But right now we are their only chance. Funny, how life works.
Person A: That is not funny.
Person A: Whoa, whoa, whoa! What are you doing? Take it outside. Hey! Those are Brightbill’s baby pictures. Put that down! What the... No, no, no, no, no! Knock it off! You think those grow on trees?

Person A: Mmmmmmmaybe one more...
Person A: Hey, no! Fink only.
Person A: Fink.
Person B: Hey, kid.
Person A: Roz! What are you doing? Quit messing around!
Person A: It’s Brightbill. He needs to talk to you.
Person B: What are you saying, you’re leaving?

Person A: You don’t need to.
Person A: Yes. To protect all of you, there are things there that I must put right.
Person B: Ugh, squirrels.
